entry.def: If you describe someone as vociferous, you mean that they speak with great energy and determination, because they want their views to be heard.

example.ex: He was a vociferous opponent of Conservatism...
His resentment of her behaviour was becoming more vociferous.
example.tran: 他越来越大声地表达对她行为的厌恶。

means.word_mean: 1. conspicuously and offensively loud; given to vehement outcry;

auth_sentence.content: Her son is a vociferous campaigner for gay marriage.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her son is a vociferous campaigner for gay marriage.

stems_affixes.word_buile: equi平等+vocal[adj.声音的;有声的;歌唱的]→两种声音的,听不清楚的→意义含糊的
ir不+revocable可取消的→adj.不可取消的
voci=voc出声,叫喊,看+fer带来+ous……的→带来声音的→喧闹的
advocate拥护+or人→n.拥护者, 提倡者
voc出声,叫喊,看+able能……的→能发出声的→词
vocabul=vocable[n.[无义]词, 词外壳]+ary表名词→n.词汇,词汇量;词汇表
voc出声,叫喊,看+al表名词→n.元音;声乐作品
vocal[adj.声音的;有声的;歌唱的]+ist人→n.流行歌手,声乐家

stems_affixes.value_cn: 职业;召唤;天命;天职;才能
stems_affixes.word_buile: voc出声,叫喊,看+ation表名词→[受到]召唤→天职;职业
vow=voc出声,叫喊,看+el表名词→n.元音；元音字母
con共同+voc出声,叫喊,看+ation表名词→n.召集,会议
ad加强+voc出声,叫喊,看+ate表动词→增强声音→拥护
equi平等+voc出声,叫喊,看+ate表动词→两种声音听不清楚→支吾其词
